empty.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: an empty space behind the desk
empty.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an empty place does not have any people in it
empty.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I hate coming home to an empty house.
The building stood empty for several years.
empty.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I spotted an empty table in the corner.
He put his feet on an empty chair.
empty.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: unhappy because nothing in your life seems interesting or important
empty.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The divorce left him feeling empty and bitter.
Her life felt empty and meaningless.
empty.translation[0].note_box[0].section: with nothing in it or on it
empty
used about something that has nothing inside
an empty can of hair spray
The fridge is almost empty.
blank
used about a computer screen or a piece of paper that has no writing or pictures on it, or a CD, DVD etc with nothing recorded on it
a blank sheet of paper
He stared at the blank screen for a few minutes.
a blank tape
used about a room or cupboard that has very little in it
His room was bare except for a bed and a wardrobe.
hollow
used about something that has an empty space inside
a hollow tree
The suitcase had a hollow bottom.
with no people
empty
used about a place that has no one in it or no one using it
There were no lights on and the house looked empty.
the empty streets
used about a seat, space, or room that is available to use because no one else is using it
Is this seat free?
There are never any parking spaces free at this time of day.
vacant
used about a room or building that is available for people to pay to use
a vacant apartment
The next guesthouse we tried had a couple of rooms vacant.
deserted
used about a place that is quiet because there is no one there, or because the people who used to be there have left
a deserted village
It was three o'clock in the morning and the streets were deserted.
uninhabited
used about a place that has no people living in it, especially permanently
an uninhabited island
unoccupied
used about a house, room, or office that no one is living in or using at the moment
unoccupied buildings
Burglaries frequently happen when people are on holiday and their house is unoccupied.
empty.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to remove everything that is inside something
empty.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Ruth emptied her glass (=drank all the liquid left in it) in one gulp.
Elinor emptied the contents of the envelope onto the table.
empty.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if a place empties, everyone leaves it
empty.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The stores were closing, and the streets began to empty.
